snippet: The vote in the Republican-controlled House, in which more than 23 Republicans joined Democrats in opposing the measure, suggested that the bill might die this year.
abstract: Missouri's Republican-controlled House votes to adopt so-called right-to-work bill, but without sufficient votes to override expected veto from Jay Nixon, state's Democratic governor; 23 Republicans joined Democrats to oppose the measure.
lead_paragraph: The vote in the Republican-controlled House, in which more than 23 Republicans joined Democrats in opposing the measure, suggested that the bill might die this year.

headline.main: Missouri House Passes ‘Right to Work’ Bill, Ignoring Threat of a Veto
headline.print_headline: Missouri House Passes Anti-Union Bill, Ignoring Threat of a Veto

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: National Right to Work Legal Defense Foundation
